meanings.definition: Concerned chiefly or only with oneself
meanings.sent1: Her selfishness behavior upset her friends.
meanings.sent2: His selfishness made it hard for others to trust him.
meanings.sent3: The cat's selfishness over the sunny spot on the couch was comical.
meanings.sent4: The selfishness attitude of the storm clouds kept the sun hidden.
meanings.sent5: The selfishness nature of the bear was evident as it hoarded all the honey.

meanings.definition: Having or showing concern only for oneself
meanings.sent1: The selfishness decision to keep all the toys to himself upset the other children.
meanings.sent2: She displayed selfishness behavior by refusing to share her snacks.
meanings.sent3: The selfishness squirrel refused to share the acorns, causing laughter among the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The selfishness river only flowed for its own benefit, ignoring the thirsty animals nearby.
meanings.sent5: His selfishness actions spoke louder than his words, showing his true nature.

meanings.definition: Lacking consideration for others; concerned chiefly with one's own personal profit or pleasure
meanings.sent1: The selfishness businessman cared only about his own wealth.
meanings.sent2: Their selfishness behavior at the party made others feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The selfishness flower hogged all the sunlight, leaving the others in the shade.
meanings.sent4: The selfishness wind only blew in its own direction, ignoring the needs of the sailors.
meanings.sent5: The selfishness decision to cut down the trees showed a lack of concern for the environment.
